STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 16, 2021
Maureen Clore
Antrim/Charlevoix/Emmet County DHHS
2229 Summit Park Drive
Petoskey, MI 49770
RE: License #: CP240201034
Antrim/Charlevoix/Emmet County DHHS
2229 Summit Park Drive
Petoskey, MI 49770
Dear Ms. Clore:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on August 26,
2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, and Modified Implementation
Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of
the MISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please submit this required Corrective Action Plan to Claudia Triestram via email at
triestramc@michigan.gov.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
Two of 3 foster home files reviewed had a reevaluation completed less than 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster homme. One file had an
expiration date of 01/19/2021 and an approved date of 01/19/2021 and the other
foster home file had an expiration date of 08/24/2021 and a reevaluation approval
date of 08/23/2021 which are both less than the requirement of the above rule.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Six of 42 updated service plans reviewed had report dates beyond the requirements
of the above rule. The number of days beyond the requirement of this rule as
follows: 162, 100, 24, 1, 2, and 2 days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/06/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 08/26/2020
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements except for the following:
4

DHHS Policy TIMELY ENTRY OF CASEWORKER CONTACTS
FOM 722-06H
page 15-16
All caseworker contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS; this
includes attempted contacts and missed appointments, and all
pertinent information obtained must be summarized and
included in the appropriate section of the case service plan. All
face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS, within five
business days of the contact.
Two of 12 foster care services files reviewed had late entry into MiSACWIS. One
case had a 02/23/2021 video conference entered into MiSACWIS on 03/02/2021.
The other case had 9 of 19 face to face contacts entered late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/06/2020 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 08/26/2020
DHHS Policy CASEWORKER CONTACT CHILD IN OUT-OFHOME
FOM 722-06H PLACEMENT
The primary caseworker must have face-to-face contact with
each child as indicated below. First Two Months after Initial
Placement or a Placement Change • The caseworker must have
at least two face-to-face contacts per month with each child in
the first two months following an initial placement or a
placement change. • The first face-to-face contact must take
place within five business days of the date of removal or
placement change.
Two of 12 foster care services files reviewed did not have two face to face contacts
between the caseworker and the child after an initial placement or change of
placement.
5

SRM 200 Fingerprints
All personnel, contractors, vendors, and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete Security
Awareness Training (SAT). Training is available on the Learning
Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel and contractors
with access to LMS. Non-contracted agencies will complete Finger
Print Security Awareness Training via the MDHHS public licensing
website.
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes SAT timely. DCWL field consultants will monitor
completion of SAT for all CPAs as part of the annual licensing
inspection.
Three of 5 personnel required to have SRM 200 training did not have the training
timely.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period which was approved on 08/26/2020
and addressed the following violations:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2)(a) Initial Service Plans timeliness
(2)(b) Updated Service Plans timeliness
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
MISEP 6.33 Assessments and service plans. Signatures.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings
FOM 722-08C Caregiver signatures
FOM 722-06H Caseworker Contacts – Timely Entry
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION.
6

VII. CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR ASSESSMENT
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 08/24/2021. It showed a
thorough review of foster care services files and a corrective action plan to resolve
what she had found.
Interviews
The supervisor and foster care workers interviewed felt supported and are provided
the tools they need to perform their role.
VIII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or policy. Upon receipt
of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue
on a regular license.
September 16, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 16, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
